intro: Pleiarina adamauensis, commonly known as the Adamaua pleiarina, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite and often have a rough texture, while its stems are woody and branched. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological roles in its native habitat.
